briefdescription.para: Default constructor. Initializes both arguments to 0.
Creates the exponentiation of & leftOperand wrt rightOperand.
Gives the type of a Pow object.
Returns the numerical factor of the expression, i.e. returns C if the expression if of the form C*x (x having a numerical factor equal to 1), and return 1 else.

simplesect.para: This function returns the factor in an Expression (then of Numerical type).
The numerical factor in front of the expression.

briefdescription.para: This function returns the same expression as *this but amputated of its numerical factor. Example: (4*cos(x) -> cos(x)).

simplesect.para: The term without numerical factor corresponding to *this.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of possible factors in the expr.

simplesect.para: A function of the exponent if it is a Number.
1 else.

briefdescription.para: Returns all the possible factors.

simplesect.para: The concatenation of all possible factors for the arguments.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::vector< Expr > const &factors, std::vector< Expr > &exponents) const override
memberdef.name: getExponents

briefdescription.para: Fills in a vector the exponents corresponding to some factors for the expression.

detaileddescription.para: For example, an expression like $ 2ax^2\cos y $ will have exponents $ (1, 2, 0) $ for the set of factors $ (a, x, y). $ factors and exponents must of course be of the same size. Otherwise the behaviour is undefined.

simplesect.para: This function assumes that the expression is canonical, in particular that no terms like $ x\cdot x^2 $ can appear.
This function does not take into account factors in sums like $ (1 + x) $ (this will return a factor 0 for $ x $).

parameterdescription.para: Exponents (out variable, modified during the run).

briefdescription.para: Tells if the factor expr appear in the exponentiation.

simplesect.para: True if expr can factor the exponentiation.
False else.

briefdescription.para: Suppresses the term expr in the exponentiation.

simplesect.para: This function supposes that the function askTerm() has been called precedently and does not warn the user if the factor expr is not present.

parameterdescription.para: Factor to suppress in the exponentiation.

simplesect.para: The exponentiation divided by expr.

briefdescription.para: Returns the expression where the factor factor^exponent has been suppressed.

detaileddescription.para: This function works the same manner as getExponents().

parameterdescription.para: Exponent of the factor to suppress.

simplesect.para: The modified expression if the factor has been found.
std::nullopt else.
This function may replace in the future the functions askTerm() and suppressTerm().

memberdef.argsstring: (int mode=0, std::ostream &out=std::cout, LibraryMode libMode=LibraryMode::NoLib) const override
memberdef.name: print

briefdescription.para: Displays the abstract in standard output.

parameterdescription.para: Tells if the Abstract is printed alone (default) or in another expr.

briefdescription.para: Creates a LaTeX output for the Abstract.

parameterdescription.para: Tells if the Abstract is printed alone (default) or in another expr.

simplesect.para: The string corresponding to the LaTeX output.

briefdescription.para: Return the exponentiation of the two arguments.

simplesect.para: The exponentiation of the scalar evaluation of the two arguments.
For this function to be justified, all the arguments must be scalar and real.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the Abstract.

detaileddescription.para:
Replaces all variables by their value and evaluating. This function must be used instead of evaluateScalar() when treating not only real scalars.* In particular (x=2, y=3) x+iy evaluates to 3+ 3i whereas evaluateScalar() would return 3.
The abstract result of the evaluation.

briefdescription.para: Merge composition of exponentiations.

detaileddescription.para:
This function replaces compositions of exponentiations. For example (a^b)^c -> a^(b*c).
True if terms have been merged.
False else.

briefdescription.para: Derives the exponentiation.

simplesect.para: The derivative following the formula ...

briefdescription.para: Develops the exponentiation by expanding the sums inside.

parameterdescription.para: If true the expandment is recursive through all the Abstract.

simplesect.para: The expanded exponentiation.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::function< bool(Expr const &)> const &f, bool full=false, bool inplace=false) const override
memberdef.name: expand_if

briefdescription.para: Develops the Abstract.

detaileddescription.para:
This function concerns only products (and exponents) that will be flatten to give at the end a sum of independant terms.
f
Functions that returns a boolean that determines which arguments must be expanded in products.
full
If true the expandment is recursive through all the Abstract.
The expand Abstract.

briefdescription.para: Determines if the expression is a mononomial term in expr, i.e. a term of the form C*expr^n with C independent of expr, n integer.

simplesect.para: The order of the exponent if there is one (n in the example).
-1 else.

briefdescription.para: Calculates and returns the polynomial term corresponding to *this with the variable t_variable at order order. In particular, this function assumes that the checks have already been made with the function isPolynomial().

parameterdescription.para: Variable of the polynomial. \order Order of *this in t_variable.

simplesect.para: The same expression as (*this) with the term t_variable^order removed.

briefdescription.para: Returns the parity property of the expression with respect to t_variable.

simplesect.para: 1 if the expression is even in t_variable.
-1 if the expression is odd in t_variable.
0 else.

briefdescription.para: Compares the Abstract with another.

detaileddescription.para:
Here if two Abstracts have the same name, the function will return true even if they are not mathematically equal. So beware not to name different things the same way.
expr
Abstract to compare.
True if the two Abstracts are the same (or have the same name).
False else.

briefdescription.para: Handles the exponentiation of one Abstract wrt another.
